topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Deploy the HPE Linux Patch

body.section:
The HPE Linux glibc patch fixes a buffer overflow condition on systems running HPE Linux. The condition is due to multiple stack-based buffer overflows in the send_dg and send_vc functions in the libresolv library in the GNU C Library (called glibc or libc6). The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEÂ®) bulletin CVE-2015-7547 describes the condition.
Files added\impacted by this patch:
libc6
libc-bin
libc-dev-bin
libc6-dev
locales
multiarch-support

Download the patch
If you have not downloaded the patch, launch the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files. In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
Download the Helion Carrier Grade 1.1 hLinux001 Patch001 patch and the associated checksum and signature files.
Verify the downloaded signature and the downloaded checksums.
Extract the compressed file until the new-debian and old-debian directories and README are available:
Extract the HCG1.1_hLinux001_Patch001.tar.gz compressed file.
Extract the HCG1.1_hLinux001_Patch001.tar compressed file.
Copy all six the (6) new Debian (.deb) files from new-debian directory to /tmp directory on the following servers:
For KVM Deployments, you must copy six the (6) new Debian (.deb) files to the:
lifecycle manager VM;
three HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade controllers in the non-KVM region.
For KVM + ESX Deployments, you must copy six the (6) new Debian (.deb) files to the::
lifecycle manager VM;
three HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade controllers in the non-KVM region;
DCN host;
VRS-G node;
ESX Compute Proxy host.

p.b: Patch the lifecycle manager VM and non-KVM controllers

section.p: After copying the patch files, use the following steps to deploy the patch onto the lifecycle manager VM and the three HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade controllers in the non-KVM region:

ol.li: Log into the lifecycle manager host as the root user.

Log into the lifecycle manager VM as root. ssh <CLM_IP>
The CLM_IP is located on the lifecycle manager host in the ~/infra-ansible-playbooks/group_vars/all file under the hlm_clmstaticip field.
Verify that the (6) new Debian (.deb) files have been copied to the /tmp/ directory.

SSH into the non-KVM controller Ctrl 0 using the CLM IP of the controller. Log in as the cghelion user. No password is required.ssh cghelion@<CLM_IP>
The CLM IP is located on the lifecycle manager VM in the /var/hlm/clouds/<cloud_name>/desired_state/<cloud_name>/001/base/stage/ansible/hosts file. Look in the [BASE-CCP-T1] section:
Repeat the steps to verify the Debian files and execute the same command.
Repeat the steps to verify the Debian files and execute the same command.
Repeat the steps to verify the Debian files and execute the same command.

section.p: For KVM + ESX deployments, use the following steps to deploy the patch onto the DCN Host, the VRS-G node, and ESX Compute Proxy node.

ol.li: From the lifecycle manager VM, SSH into the DCN host.
Verify that the (6) new Debian (.deb) files have been copied to the /tmp/ directory.

Execute the following command to patch the DCN host: dpkg -i /tmp/libc6_2.19-18+deb8u3_amd64.deb /tmp/libc-bin_2.19-18+deb8u3_amd64.deb /tmp/libc-dev-bin_2.19-18+deb8u3_amd64.deb /tmp/libc6-dev_2.19-18+deb8u3_amd64.deb /tmp/locales_2.19-18+deb8u3_all.deb /tmp/multiarch-support_2.19-18+deb8u3_amd64.deb
From the lifecycle manager VM, SSH into the VRS-G node.
Repeat the steps to verify the Debian files and execute the same command.
From the lifecycle manager VM, SSH into the ESX Compute Proxy node.
Repeat the steps to verify the Debian files and execute the same command.
